thread.title: Beaver Dam celebrates new pickleball courts
thread.title_full: Beaver Dam celebrates new pickleball courts

title: Beaver Dam celebrates new pickleball courts
text:
The city of Beaver Dam held a ribbon-cutting ceremony on Aug. 28 for the new JM Kastenmeier Pickleball Courts, a premier 9-court pickleball complex at Athletic Field Park. The project is a collaborative effort between the city of Beaver Dam, local volunteers, and the Beaver Dam Area Community Foundation to transform the existing courts.
City officials including Mayor Mike Wissell, alder Bobbi Marck, city administrator Nathan Thiel, donors, the volunteer pickleball committee, the BDACF, and contractors gathered to commemorate this milestone.
“These new courts provide a fantastic venue for residents to stay active, socialize, and enjoy the outdoors,” said Mayor Wissell. “This project stands as a testament to what can be achieved when we come together with a shared vision for enhancing our city's recreational facilities.”
The celebration offered a tour of the new facility and a pickleball clinic. The facility is open to the public from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily.
